talk.author: did:plc:b3ksymf3qvbibquny3faopes
talk.utter: Halo 5 & Infinite having to fuck with map scaling/add ledges everywhere to preserve map flow bc your character can effectively add 50% to their valid jump distance & 25% to their valid jump height, for the low low cost of .2 seconds of gun-down time & a janky hand animation, is NOT fluid design!

talk.author: did:plc:sx2z6zhnvrg6ynbh3a2j7tra
talk.utter:
Map scaling was added to allow certain weapons to play to their strengths compared to previous titles. Also, smaller sized maps made spawning a nightmare because of said precision weapon.

Ledges were added for accessibility reasons. Instead of having random creases, they added ledges.

talk.author: did:plc:b3ksymf3qvbibquny3faopes
talk.utter:
All those changes happened because H5 was focused on being fundamentally different from H3 OR H4, & no, sorry, you don't get to claim simple accessibility when the addition of the function fundamentally changes map flow. 

They were substantive changes, they made navigation trivial, & they felt bad.

Halo 3 and 4 brought in gimmicks that down more harm than good to the sandbox.

talk.author: did:plc:b3ksymf3qvbibquny3faopes
talk.utter:
This is so off-base that I don't even know where to start. 

Halo 5 is more like Unreal than it is Halo CE. It's blistering fast, has a snappy TTK & rewards mechanical prowess over tactics 100% of the time.

Besides, my initial point was about how ledges + clamber = maps with loose flow, not...this.
